title: Jasa Veremalua
text:
Jasa Veremalua (born 29 May 1988) is a Fijian <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> player who plays for the <a href="San%20Diego%20Legion">San Diego Legion</a> in <a href="Major%20League%20Rugby">Major League Rugby</a> (MLR). He also plays for the <a href="Fiji%20national%20rugby%20sevens%20team">Fiji sevens</a> team. Veremalua made his debut for at the <a href="2013%20Wellington%20Sevens">2013 Wellington Sevens</a>.
He is from Korotogo Village in the Nadroga Navosa Province.
Youth and early career.
Jasa Veremalua was born and raised in Korotogo, Baravi, <a href="Nadroga">Nadroga</a> and he started his career playing rugby in the local 7's competition. He has been playing for the famous Red Rock 7's Team since 2012. His father died in 2005 when he was just 19. He regards his Red Rock coach, Lote Rasiga as a father-figure
He attended Sigatoka Methodist Primary School then Sigatoka Methodist College and then went on to <a href="St%20Thomas%20High%20School">St Thomas High School</a> in Lautoka. He then attended <a href="Fiji%20National%20University">Fiji National University</a> in <a href="Ba%20%28town%29">Ba</a> to do his Diploma in Automobile and Road Transport studies. He joined Senibiau Rugby Club in Nadroga in 2006 and later joined Natabua Rugby club from 2010–2011.
In 2012, he was named best player won the Campese-Serevi Medal during the Coral Coast 7's.
National team.
He was later selected by the then Fiji 7's coach, Alifereti Dere into the 7's team. In March 2013, he was offered a contract by <a href="Stade%20Toulousain">Stade Toulousain</a> to play in the <a href="Top%2014">Top 14</a> competition but due to an injury, the offer was taken back.
In 2016, his performance in the <a href="2016%20USA%20Sevens">2016 USA Sevens</a> saw him win the <a href="DHL">DHL</a> Impact player of the tournament.
He was also instrumental in helping Fiji win their 2nd title in a row after Fiji took out the <a href="2015%E2%80%9316%20World%20Rugby%20Sevens%20Series">2015–16 World Rugby Sevens Series</a> during the <a href="2016%20London%20Sevens">2016 London Sevens</a> by reaching the cup quarterfinals. He was crowned the DHL Impact Player of the 2015‑16 7s series as well as making the Dream Team of the series.
